intro: Chorizanthe brevicornu, commonly known as the short-horned cholla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring succulent stems that store water and reduce transpiration. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and bloom in late spring or early summer. Chorizanthe brevicornu plays a role in desert ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
